name: Smoked Chicken Hot Wings
author: Twayminator
summary: Smoked chicken wings that are tender and delicious. Serve with celery sticks and blue cheese dressing.
ingredients: ⅔ cup hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's RedHot®)
directions: Heat a smoker to 225 degrees F (110 degrees C) according to manufacturer's directions
Mix 1 tablespoon salt, pepper, and Cajun seasoning in a small bowl to make dry rub
Cook chicken wings in the preheated smoker until tender, 1 to 1 1/4 hour
Combine hot pepper sauce, butter, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, and salt in a small saucepan over low heat
Cook, stirring often, until butter is melted and sauce is smooth
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate
Transfer smoked wings to a large bowl; stir in 1/2 of the sauce until wings are evenly coated
Grill coated wings until skin is browned and starting to get crispy, 4 to 5 minutes per side
Transfer to a large bowl and stir in remaining sauce until wings are well-coated
